content.title: ICMR-Junior Research Fellowship
content.beneficiary: Post Graduate students in basic and social sciences
content.details: The ICMR-JRF entrance examination is conducted annually for selecting candidates for Junior Research Fellowships in biomedical and social sciences.
eligibility: Post Graduate degree (M.Sc./MA) in basic science or professional courses
55% marks for General/OBC and 50% for SC/ST/PH/VH
Upper age limit of 28 years with relaxations for certain categories
exclusions: Candidates with B. Tech/M. Tech in biomedical sciences, B. Pharma/M. Pharma or D.Pharma are not eligible
content.application_process: Online application through the ICMR website.

faqs.question: When is the ICMR-JRF entrance examination usually announced?
faqs.answer: The examination notice is published in leading English Newspapers of India usually during March/April.

faqs.question: Where will the Centres for the written examination located?
faqs.answer: Test for ICMR JRF is conducted at twelve Centres including Bengaluru, Bhopal, Bhubaneswar, Chandigarh, Chennai, Delhi, Guwahati, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Mumbai, Srinagar, and Varanasi.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of the written examination?
faqs.answer: The paper consists of two Sections: Aptitude Section with 50 compulsory questions and subject-specific sections for Life sciences and Social sciences.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the written examination?
faqs.answer: The test will consist of one paper of two hours duration.

faqs.question: What is the tenure of the fellowship?
faqs.answer: JRF is generally for the first two years, which may be upgraded to SRF after successful assessment.
